body: Would it be acceptable for you to convert your date to an instant and use: [isBetween(java.time.Instant,java.time.Instant)](https://www.javadoc.io/static/org.assertj/assertj-core/3.18.0/org/assertj/core/api/AbstractInstantAssert.html#isBetween(java.time.Instant,java.time.Instant))?

Yes, I can convert `validatingDate` to `Instant` and use `isBetween` for `Instant` but then there's no need to have `AbstractDateAssert` in test framework because each `Date` could be converted to `Instant` and saved to variable.  :)  I think that the main reason to use assertj and to have `AbstractDateAssert` inside it is to help programmer to write code easier without his own boilerplate or thinking about such natural conversions. One more reason to have such methods (having `Instant` as parameter) in `AbstractDateAssert` is that `Instant` is an official replacement for `Date` and we must provide the ability to use new better API.

Fair enough.
Are you keen to contribute it?

I think, for completeness, I can contribute all such methods:
```
isEqualTo(Instant instant)
isEqualToIgnoringHours(Instant instant)
isEqualToIgnoringMinutes(Instant instant)
isEqualToIgnoringSeconds(Instant instant)
isEqualToIgnoringMillis(Instant instant)
isNotEqualTo(Instant instant)
isIn(Instant... instants)
isNotIn(Instant... instants)
isBefore(Instant other)
isBeforeOrEqualTo(Instant other)
isAfter(Instant instant)
isAfterOrEqualTo(Instant instant)
isBetween(Instant start, Instant end)
isBetween(Instant start, Instant end, boolean inclusiveStart, boolean inclusiveEnd)
isBetween(Instant start, Instant end, boolean inclusiveStart, boolean inclusiveEnd)
isNotBetween(Instant start, Instant end)
isInSameYearAs(Instant instant)
isInSameMonthAs(Instant instant)
isInSameDayAs(Instant instant)
isInSameHourWindowAs(Instant instant)
isInSameHourAs(Instant instant)
isInSameMinuteWindowAs(Instant instant)
isInSameMinuteAs(Instant instant)
isInSameSecondWindowAs(Instant instant)
isInSameSecondAs(Instant instant)
isCloseTo(Instant instant, long deltaInMilliseconds)
hasSameTimeAs(Instant instant)
usingInstantComparator(Comparator<? super Instant> customComparator)
usingInstantComparator(Comparator<? super Instant> customComparator, String customComparatorDescription)
```

Cool but let's do one thing at a time, let's start with `isBetween` and then we can move to do the other progressively, big PR are really hard to review as you often have the same issues being replicated.

I'm not sure what the usage for `usingInstantComparator` would be, the comparator is for actual (thus Date)

issue.title: Add AbstractDateAssert.isBetween for Instant bounds

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
#### Check List:
* Fixes #2032
* Unit tests : YES
* Javadoc with a code example (on API only) : YES

Because it's not possible to add assertionInvocationWithInstantArg to base class and don't override it in other derived classes (then I must add other methods for Instant) I had added it in the derived classes. At the next step, when there will be Instant methods for all derived classes it can be pulled up to the base class.

body: @joel-costigliola I think it's correct to integrate my implementation into main because I took this issue to resolve, the code already have been done and pull requests already have been created before you integrate your implementation.

Sorry @ars-java, I integrated some of your work and since you did not seem active on the issue I took over and informed you about it but then you raised new PRs the thing I had already quite advanced the work so integrated your PRs was more work than finishing the issue.
Don't worry I'll give you full credit for the issue in the release notes.
